parties.title: The Talk Show with John Gruber Live
parties.details: Tickets are not yet available, but will be soon.

parties.title: Beard Bash 2017 at WWDC
parties.details:
Why is it called the Beard Bash?

Quite simple because I have a big beard and it seemed like a fun name.

Do I need a beard to attend?

LOL, no. The party is open to developers in town during WWDC, although space is limited.

Why do you have a party?

I’ve been doing this party for the last six years as a way to say thanks to developers for all the hard work they do. It’s a night where they don’t have to worry about anything, just having a good time.

Will there be music?

Oh yes! We have a band play every year. This will be a concert party with great music!

Do I need a ticket?

Yes. Tickets are free, but you will need to RSVP in order to attend the party. The process is very simple—we will make an announcement on how to RSVP as we get closer to WWDC.

Can I bring a friend?

If your friend registers for a ticket, sure 🙂

Will alcohol be served?

Yes, beer (lots of Heineken) and wine will be free. Mixed drinks can be purchased. There will also be non-alcoholic beverages available.

Do I need to be 21 years old to attend?

No, this is an all ages party. If you would like to drink, you will need to show your ID to get a wrist band.

Where and when will the party be held?

The party is being held at the City National Civic Center in San Jose—directly across the street from WWDC. The event will be on 
Monday, June 5, 2017 from 8 pm -12 am.

Is the party sponsored?

Yes we have a number of companies that sponsor the party. There are limited sponsorship spots available, but if you are interested please email me directly.

parties.title: James Dempsey and the Breakpoints
parties.details:
Save The Date!
Wednesday Night, June 7, 2017
We're gearing up for a show during WWDC week that you will not want to miss. For the second year, we’re teaming up with WWDCGirls for an evening of mingling and music to benefit App Camp For Girls.

Playing humorous tech songs, including favorites from their Billboard-charting album Backtrace, the annual James Dempsey and the Breakpoints show has become a WWDC week tradition. No WWDC ticket is required—anyone in town for the week can attend.

This year we're performing at the amazing City National Civic Theater—right across the street from WWDC. 

We'll announce full details soon — but it is shaping up to be our biggest show ever, we’re very excited!

The show sold out quickly last year. Join our low-volume list to find out first when tickets are available.

parties.title: WWDC 2017 - San Jose Relay FM Meetup
parties.details: Come hangout with Relay FM on Monday, June 5 at the San Jose Museum of Quilts and Textiles. The event runs from 7:00 - 9:30 PM. We will be serving several different local craft beers and SUPER FANCY Italian sodas. The event is open to all ages, but be sure to have your ID if you want a beer.
parties.address1: San Jose Museum of Quilts and Textiles

parties.title: Better Elevation Extravaganza
parties.details:
We've been hard at work on something really cool that we think you'll enjoy. This party is where we finally get to talk about it, celebrate, and thank the community that helped inspire us.

Free drinks
Live music from Airplane Mode and The Outer Vibe
A series of delightful surprises
Guaranteed fun or your money back
If you're a member of an underrepresented group and want to make sure you can get a ticket, please contact Dave. We want this to be an amazing event where everyone feels welcome.

It's going to be a great year for indie creators. We owe a lot to Apple and the development community. Let's party.

parties.title: Accidental Tech Podcast Live
parties.details:
Accidental Tech Podcast Live @ AltConf, June 5th - 5pm
Monday June 5th, 2017 5-7pm. Limited availability for this one-off event - reserve your spot today!

parties.title: Apple WWDC Keynote Breakfast & Viewing
parties.details:
Come have a hearty breakfast and watch the WWDC Keynote courtesy of thoughtbot before heading down to San Jose! Say hello to other early rising developers & designers while sipping on mimosas.
This event is open to everyone, regardless of whether or not you snagged a ticket to WWDC. AltConf attendees and hungry iOS developers are welcome!

parties.title: buddybeers: WWDC Edition
parties.details:
Join the buddybuild team at Paper Plane SJ for a special WWDC edition of buddybeers!
Mix, mingle, and discuss the latest Apple news with your fellow app developers over a cocktail, pint (or two)!
There'll be complimentary food / drinks, special edition t-shirts and other goodies to give away, and we'll help you setup your first mobile CI build for your app!
Space is limited, so reserve your spot today! 


Buddybuild is a continuous integration, deployment and user insights platform built specifically for mobile development teams.

This happy hour is hosted in collaboration with Parties for WWDC - the aggregator of developer parties happening in San Jose during WWDC 2017.
Download the app and swing by buddybeers to meet the creator!

parties.title: Your WWDC Comedy Fix
parties.details:
James Veitch
 
An evening of geeky comedy about life, love and enabling bluetooth.
 
Responsible for the fastest ever TED Talk to reach over two million views in the history of TED, UK comedian, musician and writer James Veitch has become renowned for his unashamedly nerdy and hilarious digital content. 
 
A former Apple Store Genius, Veitch’s comedy is high-tech: picking apart, parodying (and pranking) the fast-advancing and perplexing technology we live with. His live shows have explored technology, retro-gaming, and finding love through troubleshooting theory. 
 
He had sold-out runs at the Edinburgh Fringe in 2014, 2015 and at Soho Theatre in 2016 with his first three shows, Dot Con, Game Face and Genius Bar and has written and performed two viral hit seasons of his show Scamalot with Mashable. He’s performed across the UK, the U.S. and Scandinavia and his best selling book, Dot Con, based upon the show, was published in 2015. 
 
“Near-constant belly laughs” The Scotsman
“I laughed my ass off” The New York Times
“One to watch” The Independent
”Tears-down-the-face funny” The Sunday Herald

parties.title: Selfie Soiree
parties.details:
Episode III: Return Of The Soirée,
 
Join Button on Wednesday evening for our 3rd annual selfie soirée of extensive proportions. 
 
We'll be nearby WWDC at 2 South Market Street, with an open bar including specialty cocktails, amazing food, great music, and - most importantly - selfie backdrops to rival the likes of Apple's iPhone backgrounds.
 
Left your selfie stick at home? Don't worry, we'll have plenty on hand, but all you iPhone 7 folks -- we thought lightning only strikes once, but the cables fooled us again. Bring your own adaptor to ensure you can snap selfies.
 
#SelfieSoiree

parties.title: buddybuild breakfast
parties.details:
To help fuel developers through the many sessions, meetups, conferences and happy hours during the week of WWDC, buddybuild is serving free breakfast burritos for the iOS community!
On the mornings of June 6th and 7th, the buddybuild team will be parked near the convention center handing out breakfast burritos and sandwiches for attendees of WWDC, AltConf and Cocoaconf Next Door.
For WWDC: attendees simply need to show their badge at the food truck for a free buddybuild breakfast of their choice.
For AltConf, and CocoaConf Next Door: attendees can pick up a buddybuild breakfast ticket at their conference's registration.*
Click 'Register' to help us plan how many burritos we should prepare!
*TICKETS ARE LIMITED, AND BURRITOS WILL BE ON A FIRST-COME, FIRST-SERVED BASIS

parties.title: Setapp and Paddle WWDC 2017 Party
parties.details:
Two main things are going down in San Jose this year: there’s a Developers conference and an epic party by Setapp. We joined forces with our friends at Paddle to throw the best event for developers of the season and we just had to find the perfect spot for it.
Setapp is all about how the Mac world should be, about the future of tech and what we can do to drive it closer. We needed a space station at least. At the same time, Paddle as an e-commerce and billing giant were pushing for a prestigious and comfortable place. We looked hard and then it hit us: our perfectly comfortable spot that cradles the future was right there, in the glorious Museum of Technology and Innovation in San Jose.
We have the whole upper lever with all the exhibits to ourselves. Which means Virtual Reality, Robot and BioDesigns, and the rest of the futuristic tech at your service to explore. There are also going to be quite a few top tech journalists and an amazing developer community. Food and drinks to refill your energy tank, great people to have memorable talks, and a couple of robots in the backgrounds. Sounds pretty neat.

parties.title: Realm's Swift Panel
parties.details:
Join Chris Lattner, Jesse Squires, Kamilah Taylor and Kevin Ballard as Realm's JP Simard moderates this panel-style discussion on everything Swift.

IMPORTANT: Capacity for this event is limited. RSVPs are required to attend this event, we'll only have capacity for the first 100 people at the door by 6pm.

Schedule

* 6pm: Doors open! Mix & mingle among your fellow Swifters. Drinks and light snacks provided.
* 7pm: Panel + Q&A
* Afterwards: Stay and chat with our panelists, mix and mingle some more.

Location: We will be announcing the location as we get closer to the event - RSVP, and stay tuned we'll let you know.

Video: A livestream of the event will be available and we'll be publishing the video shortly after the event.

This panel is presented by Realm, a platform to build reactive apps, realtime collaborative features, and offline-first experiences.
